name: Fox et al., Appellants, v. Davey Compressor Company

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Fox et al., Appellants, v. Davey Compressor Company.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
At the trial in the lower court a nonsuit was entered which the court in bane subsequently refused to take off. We find no error in the record, and the judgment is affirmed on the opinion of the learned trial judge.
Judgment affirmed at appellants’ costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Henry A. J ones, for appellants.
Gifford K. Wright, of Alter, Wright <& Barron, with him J ames K. Ruby, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Fox et al., Appellants, v. Davey Compressor Company.
Argued March 28, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
Henry A. J ones, for appellants.
Gifford K. Wright, of Alter, Wright <& Barron, with him J ames K. Ruby, for appellee.
April 22, 1935:
